body.p: Oldham County, Kentucky, native. Lived in South America from 1844 to 1845. Studied law under Nathaniel Wolfe in Louisville in 1846. Raised a regiment under John C. Fremont in California in the Mexican-American War. Farmed in Missouri from 1848 to 1853. Married Sarah Benton Jacob in 1848. Moved to Oldham County, Kentucky in 1853. Represented Oldham County in the House of Representatives of the Commonwealth of Kentucky from 1859 to 1863. Appointed Colonel of the Ninth Kentucky Volunteer Cavalry, U.S.A. Elected Lieutenant Governor of the Commonwealth of Kentucky on the ticket with Thomas E. Bramlette in 1863. Arrested and expelled into Virginia by Stephen G. Burbridge in November 1864. Married Laura Wilson Jacob in 1865. Died in Louisville in 1903.
